article.headline: Holy Cross 86, Lafayette 57
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Keith Simmons scored 26 points on 9-of-11 shooting to lead Holy Cross to an 86-57 victory over Lafayette on Saturday. Simmons, who went 4-of-5 from 3-point range, also had seven rebounds and five assists. After Lafayette (6-7, 0-1 Patriot) scored the opening points of the game on a 3-pointer by Bilal Abdullah, Holy Cross went on a 9-0 run to take the lead for good. Simmons scored five points in the run and Kevin Hamilton added four points. Leading 14-10, the Crusaders (8-7, 1-0) went an an 18-0 run and led by double figures the rest of the way. Simmons scored seven more points during that run as the Crusaders opened a 47-23 halftime lead. Holy Cross led by as many as 40 in the second half. Hamilton and Torey Thomas each had 18 for the Crusaders. Lafayette was led by Abdullah with 12 points. Holy Cross has now won 14 straight conference regular-season games.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
